title: Marakkech palace named best hotel in the worldTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Marakkech palace named best hotel in the world Published on : Saturday, September 5, 2015
Decades ago when British Prime Minister Winston Churchill spoke about La Mamounia to US president Franklin Delano Roosevelt, he called it “the best address in the world”. Half a century later La Mamounia is considered the best hotel in the world and the most coveted in the Middle East and Africa according to a readers survey by Conde Nast Traveller, the British magazine dedicated to luxury travel. The Marrakech palace topped the list for its excellent service, luxury and beauty, out of 100 other destinations.
Italy emerged as the favourite holiday-destination and Paris led the list as the most loved city in the same survey.
La Mamounia has collected various prestigious awards since its foundation in 1923. It has been the hotel of the powerful and a romantic escape for wealthy couples.
Built in Moorish style with Berber and Arab-Andalusian elements, the Mamounia boasts 209 rooms, including 71 suites, orange gardens and ancient olive trees, three riads (internal gardens) a spa with hammam, the traditional Moroccan steam bath.
The hotel was renovated in 2009.
In the Conde Nast Traveller survey, La Mamounia came before The Oberoi Udaivilas (Udaipur), Singita Grumeti (Tanzania) and Cheval Blanc Saint (Saint Barth).
